history.content:
This is the master list of announcements for SP18 upper div CS classes.  Class-specific information is at the end of this post.

 

  1. To see who can enroll into CS upper div classes and when, read: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy#upper

  2. Waitlist Processing:

    1. We will NOT be purging the waitlist of non-CS/EECS majors at the end of phase 1 this semester.

    2. Wait lists are automatically processed in numerical order based on the waitlist position. A student’s major is NOT taken into consideration when the wait list is processed.

    3. If a student has a time conflict between the class and another, the system will NOT enroll them – they will be skipped when the list is processed. Time conflicts require manual enrollment. (See the note about the CS Time Conflict Override form.)

    4. If enrolling the student into the class will put them over the maximum number of units, the system will also skip the student when processing the wait list. Units for wait listed classes count towards the upper unit limit: 13.5 phase 1, 17.5 phase 2, and 20 units over all.

    5. Students on the waitlist for a class are NOT guaranteed to get into the class and should make a reasonable back-up plan.

 

  1. The 70% rule applies to nearly all upper div classes. We only open 70% of total seats until (U)GSI hiring is finalized to ensure sufficient instructional staff for the class. This means you may see open seats and get waitlisted.

    *   If this happens to you, do NOT email us about this – we don’t know when hiring will be completed and when you will get into the class.

    *   We are not using the 70% rule for very small classes where we know enough teaching staff will be available.

  3. 999 sections will be used for nearly all upper div classes. These are faux sections that allow students to enroll in the lecture and the 999 section(s) only via Cal Central.

    Since students no longer drop/re-enroll when they want to switch sections, they will no longer risk being bumped to the end of the waitlist when they need to make a change. Additionally, the 999 section has no scheduled day or time which reduces the number of time conflicts that must be processed online. It DOES mean that students need to be patient and wait until class starts to know which section they will actually attend.

    1. Students can still see the actual section days/times via classes.berkeley.edu

    2. Assignments to actual sections will be handled outside of Cal Central by faculty either:

      1. During first lecture

      2. Via communication from instructor to use alternate form (e.g. Google form)

      3. Via course home page

  5. In the event of a time conflict – students need to complete the CS Time Conflict Override form. This is a different form than the form indicated on Cal Central.

    1. This form is to request to overrides into CS classes only.

    2. It is the student’s responsibility to check the attendance policy of the conflicting classes and make plans for conflicting midterms/finals.

    3. Conflict overrides will only begin to be processed starting in Phase II.

    4. Every 3 business days, here’s how CS time conflicts are processed:

      1. If there is space available in the class and the student will not go over the unit limit, the student is enrolled.

      2. If there is no space in the lecture or section the student has requested, or if the student will go over the unit limit with enrollment, the student is deleted from the list.

     If you submit the CS Time Conflict Override form and are not enrolled within 3 business days, you need to re-submit the form to indicate you still want to get into the class!

 

The remainder of this post will contain class-specific information that will be updated as more information becomes available.

 

  • CS C100 (aka DATA c100/STAT c100) - enrollments are being coordinated by COMPSCI and will all be funneled through the COMPSCI section.  Students should enroll via CS C100.


  • CS 161 - [10/25 update] Due to a glitch in setting up the 999 section for this class, we are unable to use the 999 section for this class for SP18 only. In order to enroll, you will need to select the lecture and a section that has open seats (and presumably fits your schedule) in order to get into the class. If you select a section that is full, you will be waitlisted! (See post @5205 to see how that works)

  • CS 162 is an Early Drop Deadline class. This means that students who are enrolled and want to drop have to do by no later than end of week 2 (Jan 26 for SP18) or they’ll need to get a Dean’s permission to override.  This is done so teams aren’t left in the lurch if one of their members abandons the class late.

        [10/25 update] Due to a glitch in setting up the 999 section for this class, we are unable to use the 999 section for this class for SP18 only. In order to enroll, you will need to select the lecture and a section that has open seats (and presumably fits your schedule) in order to get into the class. If you select a section that is full, you will be waitlisted! (See post 5205 to see how that works)


  • CS 164 - [10/25 update] Due to a glitch in setting up the 999 section for this class, we are unable to use the 999 section for this class for SP18 only. In order to enroll, you will need to select the lecture and a section that has open seats (and presumably fits your schedule) in order to get into the class. If you select a section that is full, you will be waitlisted! (See post @5205 to see how that works)

  • CS 169 - [10/17 update] We just learned last night that this class will NOT be offered in SP18.

    • is an Early Drop Deadline class. (see note for CS162 about what that means)

    • is NOT using EnrollMe for SP18. Teams will be formed once the class begins.

    • Students will be able to enroll into this class according to upper div enrollment policies listed above.

  • CS 170 - Unfortunately there is a time conflict with this class, CS 189/289A,  and CS 61C. Although we do our best to avoid time conflicts between classes, given the number of CS classes offered and constraints in classroom scheduling, it is not always possible to prevent overlaps.

history.subject: (update: 10/31) SP18 Enrollment: Getting in to Upper Div COMPSCI Classes

history.content:
This is the master list of announcements for SP18 upper div CS classes.  Class-specific information is at the end of this post.

 

  1. To see who can enroll into CS upper div classes and when, read: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy#upper

  2. Waitlist Processing:

    1. We will NOT be purging the waitlist of non-CS/EECS majors at the end of phase 1 this semester.

    2. Wait lists are automatically processed in numerical order based on the waitlist position. A student’s major is NOT taken into consideration when the wait list is processed.

    3. If a student has a time conflict between the class and another, the system will NOT enroll them – they will be skipped when the list is processed. Time conflicts require manual enrollment. (See the note about the CS Time Conflict Override form.)

    4. If enrolling the student into the class will put them over the maximum number of units, the system will also skip the student when processing the wait list. Units for wait listed classes count towards the upper unit limit: 13.5 phase 1, 17.5 phase 2, and 20 units over all.

    5. Students on the waitlist for a class are NOT guaranteed to get into the class and should make a reasonable back-up plan.

 

  1. The 70% rule applies to nearly all upper div classes. We only open 70% of total seats until (U)GSI hiring is finalized to ensure sufficient instructional staff for the class. This means you may see open seats and get waitlisted.

    *   If this happens to you, do NOT email us about this – we don’t know when hiring will be completed and when you will get into the class.

    *   We are not using the 70% rule for very small classes where we know enough teaching staff will be available.

  3. 999 sections will be used for nearly all upper div classes. These are faux sections that allow students to enroll in the lecture and the 999 section(s) only via Cal Central.

    Since students no longer drop/re-enroll when they want to switch sections, they will no longer risk being bumped to the end of the waitlist when they need to make a change. Additionally, the 999 section has no scheduled day or time which reduces the number of time conflicts that must be processed online. It DOES mean that students need to be patient and wait until class starts to know which section they will actually attend.

    1. Students can still see the actual section days/times via classes.berkeley.edu

    2. Assignments to actual sections will be handled outside of Cal Central by faculty either:

      1. During first lecture

      2. Via communication from instructor to use alternate form (e.g. Google form)

      3. Via course home page

  5. In the event of a time conflict – students need to complete the CS Time Conflict Override form. This is a different form than the form indicated on Cal Central.

    1. This form is to request to overrides into CS classes only.

    2. It is the student’s responsibility to check the attendance policy of the conflicting classes and make plans for conflicting midterms/finals.

    3. Conflict overrides will only begin to be processed starting in Phase II.

    4. Every 3 business days, here’s how CS time conflicts are processed:

      1. If there is space available in the class and the student will not go over the unit limit, the student is enrolled.

      2. If there is no space in the lecture or section the student has requested, or if the student will go over the unit limit with enrollment, the student is deleted from the list.

     If you submit the CS Time Conflict Override form and are not enrolled within 3 business days, you need to re-submit the form to indicate you still want to get into the class!

 

The remainder of this post will contain class-specific information that will be updated as more information becomes available.

 

  • CS C100 (aka DATA c100/STAT c100) - enrollments are being coordinated by COMPSCI and will all be funneled through the COMPSCI section.  Students should enroll via CS C100.


  • CS 161 - [10/25 update] Due to a glitch in setting up the 999 section for this class, we are unable to use the 999 section for this class for SP18 only. In order to enroll, you will need to select the lecture and a section that has open seats (and presumably fits your schedule) in order to get into the class. If you select a section that is full, you will be waitlisted! (See post @5205 to see how that works)

  • CS 162 is an Early Drop Deadline class. This means that students who are enrolled and want to drop have to do by no later than end of week 2 (Jan 26 for SP18) or they’ll need to get a Dean’s permission to override.  This is done so teams aren’t left in the lurch if one of their members abandons the class late.

        [10/25 update] Due to a glitch in setting up the 999 section for this class, we are unable to use the 999 section for this class for SP18 only. In order to enroll, you will need to select the lecture and a section that has open seats (and presumably fits your schedule) in order to get into the class. If you select a section that is full, you will be waitlisted! (See post 5205 to see how that works)


  • CS 164 - [10/25 update] Due to a glitch in setting up the 999 section for this class, we are unable to use the 999 section for this class for SP18 only. In order to enroll, you will need to select the lecture and a section that has open seats (and presumably fits your schedule) in order to get into the class. If you select a section that is full, you will be waitlisted! (See post @5205 to see how that works)

  • CS 169 - [10/17 update] We just learned last night that this class will NOT be offered in SP18.

    • is an Early Drop Deadline class. (see note for CS162 about what that means)

    • is NOT using EnrollMe for SP18. Teams will be formed once the class begins.

    • Students will be able to enroll into this class according to upper div enrollment policies listed above.

  • CS 170 - Unfortunately there is a time conflict with this class, CS 189/289A,  and CS 61C. Although we do our best to avoid time conflicts between classes, given the number of CS classes offered and constraints in classroom scheduling, it is not always possible to prevent overlaps.

    • Read this page for more information about time conflicts: https://sis.berkeley.edu/faq/student/enrollment-faq

    • Be sure to read the section above about the CS Time Conflict Override form & how to handle conflicts.

    • [10/25 update] Due to a glitch in setting up the 999 section for this class, we are unable to use the 999 section for this class for SP18 only. In order to enroll, you will need to select the lecture and a section that has open seats (and presumably fits your schedule) in order to get into the class. If you select a section that is full, you will be waitlisted! (See post 5205 to see how that works)

  • CS 186/286A - Enrollment (and waitlist) is blocked for until we are certain a qualified instructor can be found. This shows on the system as Instructor Consent Required.

         [10/25 Update] - We are changing the enrollment to zero to avoid the confusion about how to get instructor consent when there is no instructor.

         [10/31 Update] - Enrollment for this class is now OPEN! We are excited about a solid group of lecturer candidates. As soon as a hiring decision is made, we will add the instructor name to the class. 

  • CS 188 - [10/25 update] Due to a glitch in setting up the 999 section for this class, we are unable to use the 999 section for this class for SP18 only. history.content:
This is the master list of announcements for SP18 upper div CS classes.  Class-specific information is at the end of this post.

 

  1. To see who can enroll into CS upper div classes and when, read: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy#upper

  2. Waitlist Processing:

    1. We will NOT be purging the waitlist of non-CS/EECS majors at the end of phase 1 this semester.

    2. Wait lists are automatically processed in numerical order based on the waitlist position. A student’s major is NOT taken into consideration when the wait list is processed.

    3. If a student has a time conflict between the class and another, the system will NOT enroll them – they will be skipped when the list is processed. Time conflicts require manual enrollment. (See the note about the CS Time Conflict Override form.)

    4. If enrolling the student into the class will put them over the maximum number of units, the system will also skip the student when processing the wait list. Units for wait listed classes count towards the upper unit limit: 13.5 phase 1, 17.5 phase 2, and 20 units over all.

    5. Students on the waitlist for a class are NOT guaranteed to get into the class and should make a reasonable back-up plan.

 

  1. The 70% rule applies to nearly all upper div classes. We only open 70% of total seats until (U)GSI hiring is finalized to ensure sufficient instructional staff for the class. This means you may see open seats and get waitlisted.

    *   If this happens to you, do NOT email us about this – we don’t know when hiring will be completed and when you will get into the class.

    *   We are not using the 70% rule for very small classes where we know enough teaching staff will be available.

  3. 999 sections will be used for nearly all upper div classes. These are faux sections that allow students to enroll in the lecture and the 999 section(s) only via Cal Central.

    Since students no longer drop/re-enroll when they want to switch sections, they will no longer risk being bumped to the end of the waitlist when they need to make a change. Additionally, the 999 section has no scheduled day or time which reduces the number of time conflicts that must be processed online. It DOES mean that students need to be patient and wait until class starts to know which section they will actually attend.

    1. Students can still see the actual section days/times via classes.berkeley.edu

    2. Assignments to actual sections will be handled outside of Cal Central by faculty either:

      1. During first lecture

      2. Via communication from instructor to use alternate form (e.g. Google form)

      3. Via course home page

  5. In the event of a time conflict – students need to complete the CS Time Conflict Override form. This is a different form than the form indicated on Cal Central.

    1. This form is to request to overrides into CS classes only.

    2. It is the student’s responsibility to check the attendance policy of the conflicting classes and make plans for conflicting midterms/finals.

    3. Conflict overrides will only begin to be processed starting in Phase II.

    4. Every 3 business days, here’s how CS time conflicts are processed:

      1. If there is space available in the class and the student will not go over the unit limit, the student is enrolled.

      2. If there is no space in the lecture or section the student has requested, or if the student will go over the unit limit with enrollment, the student is deleted from the list.

history.subject: SP18 Enrollment: Getting in to Upper Div COMPSCI Classes

history.content:
This is the master list of announcements for SP18 upper div CS classes.  Class-specific information is at the end of this post.

 

  1. To see who can enroll into CS upper div classes and when, read: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy#upper

  2. Waitlist Processing:

    1. We will NOT be purging the waitlist of non-CS/EECS majors at the end of phase 1 this semester.

    2. Wait lists are automatically processed in numerical order based on the waitlist position. A student’s major is NOT taken into consideration when the wait list is processed.

    3. If a student has a time conflict between the class and another, the system will NOT enroll them – they will be skipped when the list is processed. Time conflicts require manual enrollment. (See the note about the CS Time Conflict Override form.)

    4. If enrolling the student into the class will put them over the maximum number of units, the system will also skip the student when processing the wait list. Units for wait listed classes count towards the upper unit limit: 13.5 phase 1, 17.5 phase 2, and 20 units over all.

    5. Students on the waitlist for a class are NOT guaranteed to get into the class and should make a reasonable back-up plan.

 

  1. The 70% rule applies to nearly all upper div classes. We only open 70% of total seats until (U)GSI hiring is finalized to ensure sufficient instructional staff for the class. This means you may see open seats and get waitlisted.

    1. If this happens to you, do NOT email us about this – we don’t know when hiring will be completed and when you will get into the class.

    2. We are not using the 70% rule for very small classes where we know enough teaching staff will be available.

  3. 999 sections will be used for nearly all upper div classes. These are faux sections that allow students to enroll in the lecture and the 999 section(s) only via Cal Central.

    Since students no longer drop/re-enroll when they want to switch sections, they will no longer risk being bumped to the end of the waitlist when they need to make a change. Additionally, the 999 section has no scheduled day or time which reduces the number of time conflicts that must be processed online. It DOES mean that students need to be patient and wait until class starts to know which section they will actually attend.

    1. Students can still see the actual section days/times via classes.berkeley.edu

    2. Assignments to actual sections will be handled outside of Cal Central by faculty either:

      1. During first lecture

      2. Via communication from instructor to use alternate form (e.g. Google form)

      3. Via course home page

  5. In the event of a time conflict – students need to complete the CS Time Conflict Override form. This is a different form than the form indicated on Cal Central.

    1. This form is to request to overrides into CS classes only.

    2. It is the student’s responsibility to check the attendance policy of the conflicting classes and make plans for conflicting midterms/finals.

    3. Conflict overrides will only begin to be processed starting in Phase II.

    4. Every 3 business days, here’s how CS time conflicts are processed:

      1. If there is space available in the class and the student will not go over the unit limit, the student is enrolled.

      2. If there is no space in the lecture or section the student has requested, or if the student will go over the unit limit with enrollment, the student is deleted from the list.

     If you submit the CS Time Conflict Override form and are not enrolled within 3 business days, you need to re-submit the form to indicate you still want to get into the class!

 

The remainder of this post will contain class-specific information that will be updated as more information becomes available.

 

  • CS C100 (aka DATA c100/STAT c100) - enrollments are being coordinated by COMPSCI and will all be funneled through the COMPSCI section.  Students should enroll via CS C100.

  • CS 162 is an Early Drop Deadline class. This means that students who are enrolled and want to drop have to do by no later than end of week 2 (Jan 26 for SP18) or they’ll need to get a Dean’s permission to override.  This is done so teams aren’t left in the lurch if one of their members abandons the class late.

  • CS 169

    • is an Early Drop Deadline class. (see note for CS162 about what that means)

    • is NOT using EnrollMe for SP18. Teams will be formed once the class begins.

    • Students will be able to enroll into this class according to upper div enrollment policies listed above.

  • CS 170 - Unfortunately there is a time conflict with this class, CS 189/289A,  and CS 61C. Although we do our best to avoid time conflicts between classes, given the number of CS classes offered and constraints in classroom scheduling, it is not always possible to prevent overlaps.

    • Read this page for more information about time conflicts: https://sis.berkeley.edu/faq/student/enrollment-faq

    • Be sure to read the section above about the CS Time Conflict Override form & how to handle conflicts.

  • CS 186/286A - Enrollment (and waitlist) is blocked for until we are certain a qualified instructor can be found. This shows on the system as Instructor Consent Required.

  • CS 189/289A – Unfortunately there is a time conflict with this class, CS 170,  and CS 61C. Although we do our best to avoid time conflicts between classes, given the number of CS classes offered and constraints in classroom scheduling, it is not always possible to prevent overlaps.

    • Read this page for more information about time conflicts: https://sis.berkeley.edu/faq/student/enrollment-faq

    • Be sure to read the section above about the CS Time Conflict Override form & how to handle conflicts.

 

  • CS 198 - DeCal classes are offered at the facilitator’s discretion and probably won’t appear on the class schedule until later in Phase 2. Please check classes.berkeley.edu to see which classes are being offered - the list will be updated as more information becomes available.
